<@U18BAPQ82|andrew.pye> uploaded a file: <https://emberlondon.slack.com/files/andrew.pye/F4A22GXA9/pasted_image_at_2017_02_24_01_10_pm.png|Sourcemap alignment issue?> and commented: Hi guys! Couple of debugging questions from trying to track down a memory leak in one of our apps:

1) Has anybody seen chrome die when processing a memory profile after stopping recording? It does it for me on the app in question, but not on other ember apps.

2) Debugging the app manually is nigh on impossible because the line numbers in the sources panel are out of alignment (see screen grab). If I drop a breakpoint in, when execution pauses it's actually executing a different line to the one devtools shows it to be on. Any thoughts?

initial_comment.comment:
Hi guys! Couple of debugging questions from trying to track down a memory leak in one of our apps:

1) Has anybody seen chrome die when processing a memory profile after stopping recording? It does it for me on the app in question, but not on other ember apps.

2) Debugging the app manually is nigh on impossible because the line numbers in the sources panel are out of alignment (see screen grab). If I drop a breakpoint in, when execution pauses it's actually executing a different line to the one devtools shows it to be on. Any thoughts?

text: fwiw, in development what I do is that I disable babel
and disable sourcemaps too
so I get ES6 code that runs perfectly in chrome and I'm free of the overhead of sourcemaps
and it's ocasional errors
this will disable all babel transformations except modules

<@U040MK408> Thanks for the tip! Here's a stupid one I should've mentioned originally - the code in question is in an addon. I tried your suggestion on the host app but it didn't seem to have any effect...

it doesn't affect addons code for now
I have an RFC for that tho
